codes.description: The mail server encountered a temporary failure. If the command is repeated without any change, it might be completed. Mail servers can use temporary failures like this to keep untrusted senders at bay.

responses.response: smtp;451 4.7.1 Sorry, the service is currently unavailable. Please come back later.

codes.description: The mail server encountered a temporary failure. If the command is repeated without any change, it might be completed. Mail servers can use temporary failures like this to keep untrusted senders at bay.

The mail server encountered a temporary failure. If the command is repeated without any change, it might be completed. Mail servers can use temporary failures like this to keep untrusted senders at bay.

responses.response: smtp;450 4.2.1 The recipient has exceeded message rate limit. Try again later.

codes.description: The transaction failed permantently. The server will not try to send the message again.

The transaction failed permantently. The server will not try to send the message again. This is used as a general error code, so there are many reasons why you could be seeing it.

Itâ€™s common for email service providers to add a status code (5.1.1) after the SMTP reply code (smtp;550) for additional categorization of the issue.

responses.response: smtp;550 5.7.1 Policy rejection on the target address
smtp;550 5.7.1 Email rejected per DMARC policy for mail.ru #

codes.description: The transaction failed permantently. The server will not try to send the message again.

responses.response: smtp;554 5.7.1 [1] Message rejected under suspicion of SPAM;
